properties.name: Auschwitz
properties.description: Posted by TaylormThis is Auschwitz. As we all already know, Auschwitz was the death camp in the Holocaust. Millions of people were killed here. Adolf Hitler became the dictator of Germany in 1933. He had everyone who wasn\'t perfect or just anyone he didn\'t like sent to concentration camps to work. This particular camp, you worked and were killed. They Nazi\'s made the people dig mass graves and when they were done digging the soldiers would shoot them all into it. There were even gas chambers. People went into chambers thinking they were taking showers and all of sudden cans of gas were thrown in and they all suffocated.

properties.name: Birmingham, Alabama
properties.description: Posted by TaylormThis is Birmingham, Alabama. Here is where Martin Luthor King wrote his letter from the jail. He was imprisoned for protests and marches and stuff. This is where the four black girls were killed by a bomb at a church. Here there were also sit ins like we talked about in class.

properties.name: Denver, Colorado
properties.description: Posted by TaylormThis is Denver, Colorado. In 1976, Denver was chosen to host the Winter Olympics. The citizens didn\'t want to pay the high costs for the games so they were moved to Austria instead. Denver is also historically known as The Queen City of the Plains because of its agriculture and a few US Navy ships have been named USS Denver in honor of it.

properties.name: Indonesia
properties.description: Posted by TaylormThis is Indonesia. Here there was an awful tsunami wave that killed thousands in the year 2004. It actually hit a few other countries too. What happened was there was a huge massive earthquake and it actually managed to vibrate the earth 1 cm.

properties.name: Key West
properties.description: Posted by TaylormThis is Ernest Hemingway\'s home. He was a famous author of books such as The Old Man and the Sea, and For Whom the Bell Tolls. Although he has passed away, his home is very popular. He has over 60 cats running around freely in his home and outside. His home is now a tourist attraction.

properties.name: New Orleans, Louisiana
properties.description: Posted by TaylormThis is New Orleans. As we all already know, in August of 2005 New Orleans was destroyed by the hurricane that did barely any damage to us known as Hurrican Katrina. She killed thousands and took poeple\'s homes, belongings, and hope. The city was totally flooded and everyone had to live in the stadium as a shelter. Once the most famous city of trumpets and jazz music, it\'s famous parades and things, now almost a ghost town trying to build up again.

properties.name: Sacramento, California
properties.description: Posted by TaylormThis is Sacramento, California. This city is famous because in the California Gold Rush, Sacramento had the largest distribution of gold.

properties.name: Salt Lake City, Utah
properties.description: Posted by TaylormThis is Salt Lake City, Utah. Salt Lake City is historic because it was the host of the 2002 Winter Olympics. Also, Utah had its ow war called the Utah War. It started because preident James Bunchanan was mad at Brigham Young for not stepping down as govenor. Another reason it\'s famous is because the First Continental Railroad was built here in 1869.

properties.name: St. Augustine
properties.description: Posted by TaylormThis is St. Augustine. St. Augustine is very historical. It is the oldest European established city that is still occupied. In 2004, the estimated population was 12,157 people. It was founded by the spanish in 1565 but in 1763, the Treaty of Paris gave St Augustine to the British. It was handed to the United States in 1821.

properties.name: Walla Walla! WHOA
properties.description: Posted by TaylormThis is Walla Walla, Washington. Fun to say. Walla Walla is historical because in 1836, Marcus Whitman and his wife Narcissa went there to convert the walla walla tribe to christianity. They were both killed because the walla walla tribe thought they were poisoning the natives. Whitman College was established in their honor.
